title: 4 No-Brainer Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy Right Now
text: Artificial intelligence (AI) stocks have been delivering incredible gains to investors. And with so many companies using AI technology, there's no shortage of investment opportunities.

title: Alphabet Stock Looks Cheap Through A Long-Term Lens
text: Alphabet Inc. remains undervalued with strong long-term prospects, despite competitive threats from ChatGPT and other AI platforms. Search & other, YouTube, and Google Cloud segments all show robust revenue growth and improving profitability, with AI integration driving engagement and monetization. Waymo's disruptive potential in autonomous vehicles and strategic partnerships, plus declining hardware costs, add significant optionality to GOOGL stock's valuation.

title: Alphabet Q2: That's Why I Keep The Company In My Recommended Portfolio
text: Alphabet Inc. delivered strong Q2 results, with net revenue up 12% YoY, driven by robust growth across Search, YouTube, Google Play, and especially Google Cloud. Google Cloud's operating margin surged to 20.7%, reflecting successful AI adoption and efficiency, while overall operating profit rose 14% YoY. Management raised 2025 CapEx guidance to $85 billion, focusing on AI expansion; while aggressive, I trust Alphabet's proven leadership and strategic vision.

title: Final Trade: GOOGL, UNH, INTC, GDX
text: The final trades of the day with CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders.

title: TSLA "Lagging" EV Story, GOOGL's "Long-Term Bets," Mag 7 "Domino Effect"
text: Daniel Newman joins Diane King Hall at the NYSE set to talk about the Mag 7 after Alphabet (GOOGL) and Tesla (TSLA) showed mixed results. He doesn't see Tesla moving to the downside long-term even as EV sales plunge.

title: AI buildout is still in the beginning phase, says Jefferies' Brent Thill
text: Brent Thill, Jefferies, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss what to expect from the spate of big tech earnings.

title: Why Google Search needs to be “reconsidered”
text: However, it's not in danger of being replaced by other AI-based platforms.

title: Google's AI Push Hits 2 Billion—But Meta's Next Move Could Flip The Script
text: Alphabet Inc‘s GOOGL GOOG Google just dropped a show-stopping stat: 2 billion users are now engaging with its AI features across products like Gmail, Android, and Docs. That's a huge leap from last year—and a clear signal that Google's AI integration is scaling fast and wide.

title: Alphabet Q2 Quick Take: It's Firing On All Cylinders As Thematic Discount Fades
text: Alphabet Inc.'s latest results reinforce core ad resilience amid looming macro uncertainties ahead of the upcoming tariff implementation, providing mitigation against risks of a cyclical pullback in the ad spending environment. Google Cloud was also an exceptional bright spot in Q2, with significant share gains narrowing its gap from competition and solidifying its emerging AI moat. Not only do the results reinforce an imminent AI re-rate for GOOGL stock, but it also highlights Google's current positioning as a thematic sleeper may not last for any longer.

title: Google's AI Spend Bearing Fruit: Wolfe's Khajuria
text: Google parent Alphabet's investment in artificial intelligence and cloud is bearing fruit, says Wolfe Research Managing Director Shweta Khajuria. She discusses Alphabet's earnings and plans to increase capital expenditure on “Bloomberg Tech.

title: Palumbo: GOOGL to Reach $250, AMZN AWS "Rockin' and Rolling," Expect Tariff Volatility
text: Tariff volatility will reemerge in the short-term, says Phil Palumbo. While he sees stocks taking a hit, Big Tech will rebound and rally with more strength after anticipated volatility cools.

title: Google thrives, Tesla dives in Q2
text: Daniel Newman, CEO of The Futurum Group, digs into each company's Q2 earnings. Subscribe | http://t.st/TheStreetTV Earn.

title: Alphabet: Who Said Search Can't Still Be Sexy?
text: Alphabet Inc. delivered a strong Q2, beating top- and bottom-line estimates, with Search and YouTube returning to double-digit growth and Google Cloud accelerating. AI-driven features are revitalizing Search, countering competitive threats, while YouTube's engagement and subscription initiatives diversify revenue streams. Google Cloud's robust revenue and margin growth justify the increased capex, with AI investments showing tangible returns across the business.

title: GOOGL Q2 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Up Y/Y, Shares Rise
text: Alphabet's second-quarter 2025 results benefit from strong Search, advertising and Google Cloud revenues.

title: Alphabet delivers ‘cleanest print in a long time'
text: Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG) reported stronger-than-expected second-quarter results, with revenue and earnings boosted by gains across Search, YouTube, and Cloud, as the company accelerates its pivot into artificial intelligence. Total revenue rose 13.8% year-over-year to $96.4 billion, beating Wall Street expectations by about 3%, while earnings per share reached $2.31, ahead of the $2.18 consensus.

title: Alphabet hit with EU antitrust complaint by six digital rights groups
text: Alphabet was targeted with an EU antitrust complaint from six human and digital rights groups on Thursday which urged EU regulators to investigate whether the tech giant complies with legislation requiring it to make it easier for users to uninstall software apps.

title: Broadcom gets Google CapEx boost
text: CNBC's Kristina Partsinevelos joins 'Money Movers' to discuss Broadcom getting a CapEx boost from Google.

title: Alphabet: You'll Regret Not Getting On The AI Train
text: Alphabet Inc.'s Q2 results crushed expectations, driven by surging AI demand and explosive cloud profit growth, especially in operating margins. Google raised its AI-driven CAPEX forecast from $75B to $85B, signaling huge confidence in future AI-led profitability. Alphabet trades at a significant valuation discount to cloud peers like Amazon and Microsoft, despite superior cloud operating profit up-scaling.

title: Alphabet and Tesla earnings analysis, Keurig Dr Pepper earnings tops estimates
text: Alphabet "crushed it," Gradient Investment analyst Lisa Schreiber said when discussing Alphabet's second quarter earnings report with Brian Sozzi. Troy Gayeski, Chief Market Strategist for Future Standard, also joined the conversation to discuss the earnings report.

title: Alphabet: The Most Important Earnings Number
text: Alphabet delivered a blowout Q2 2025, with every segment showing healthy growth and cloud revenues up 32% YoY. Google is doubling down on AI, committing $85 billion in CAPEX, positioning itself as an industry leader in AI and cloud. Valuation remains compelling among big tech, and I reiterate my Strong Buy rating—Google is my favorite stock right now.

title: Alphabet pops on earnings, ramps up its CapEx spend
text: CNBC's MacKenzie Sigalos joins 'Money Movers' to discuss Alphabet shares popping as CapEx soars amid AI wars.

title: Google Stock Roars As Analysts Race To Raise Price Targets
text: Google parent Alphabet, Inc. GOOG GOOGL second-quarter results beat Wall Street's expectations for the tenth straight quarter on Wednesday. Analysts are responding by raising their price targets across the board.

title: Complete Breakdown of Alphabet's 2Q Earnings
text: AI Overviews and Mode boost Search queries 10% globally, signaling real traction in AI-native monetization.

title: ETFs to Soar Post Alphabet's Strong Q2 Earnings Results
text: Alphabet's strong Q2 results and AI momentum create opportunities among heavy GOOGL exposure ETFs like MAGS, IXP, FCOM and VOX.

title: Alphabet's Q2 Beat Proves It's Way Too Cheap
text: Alphabet Inc. delivered strong Q2 results, beating analyst estimates on both revenue and earnings per share. Revenue growth was broad-based, with Google Search showing robust 12% growth, easing concerns about AI-driven disruption. The company has a consistent track record of outperforming expectations, highlighting its operational strength and resilience.

title: D.A. Davidson's Luria: Alphabet's other properties are being held back by uncertainty about search
text: Gil Luria, D.A. Davidson analyst, joins CNBC's 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss why he's maintaining his neutral rating on Alphabet despite the company's strong quarter, why he's in favor of a company break up, and much more.

title: Alphabet: Nobody Adds $10B In CapEx If Business Is Slow (Rating Upgrade)
text: Google's 2Q25 confirmed that it has a runway to growth supported by integrating AI into its scaled search engine and products. The stock is trading below its fair value of $228.67, currently at $198.43 if we count pre-trading gains. It's also cheapest among its peers, comfortably so. Investors should know that no one spends $10B more in CapEx on a slow growing business; the higher CapEx confirms that Google is on the right track.

title: Google just gave a big boost to its AI spending. Why Meta and Amazon could follow.
text: Analysts note new tax provisions could be giving the large technology companies more flexibility to invest in chips and other AI infrastructure.

title: Aceycheck: What Alphabet said on the earnings call fed a lot of the bulls
text: Scott Aceycheck of Rex Financial discusses Alphabet's positive Q2 results and continued growth in cloud, and the issues that are still dogging Tesla.

title: GOOGL Gains & TSLA Slides: Mag 7 Earnings Paint Different Pictures
text: The first round of Mag 7 earnings showed highs and lows after hours on Wednesday. Alphabet (GOOGL) rallied after posting an earnings beat and continuing momentum toward A.I.

title: US stocks open in the green: Nasdaq, S&P 500 hit fresh all-time highs
text: US stocks were mixed on Thursday, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite pushing to new intraday records on the back of strong results from Alphabet, while the Dow lagged amid weakness in IBM and Tesla. The S&P 500 inched up 0.1%, and the Nasdaq gained 0.3%, each notching fresh all-time highs.

title: Doran: Alphabet could be a tailwind for the AI trade, which is just getting more powerful
text: BD8 Capital Partners CEO & CIO Barbara Doran discusses the pace of U.S. trade talks, and whether Alphabet's strong results could set a positive trend for the rest of the AI hyperscalers.

title: Nasdaq 100: Alphabet's Surge Offsets Tesla Slide, While IBM Pulls Dow Jones Lower
text: Alphabet's earnings beat lifts tech stocks, boosting the Nasdaq 100, while IBM drags down the Dow. US indices diverge as investors weigh mixed results.

title: Alphabet Q2: AI Search & Cloud Doing Great, But Be Wary Of ROI On Big Capex Spends
text: Alphabet's Q2 FY25 results reinforce my bullish stance, driven by AI-led growth in Search that is leading to strong user engagement and importantly, higher ad conversions. Google Cloud is showing signs of accelerated growth, evidenced by a surge in high-value deals and a robust backlog, supporting future revenue expansion. GOOGL stock remains undervalued versus peers and its own historical multiples.

title: Nasdaq futures up but Dow Jones down as Alphabet, Tesla earnings, EU deal report eyed
text: Wall Street futures were mixed ahead of Thursday's opening bell, as investors react to mixed reports afterhours from tech giants Alphabet and Tesla, and reports of a potential trade deal between the US and the European Union. Dow Jones futures were down 0.4%, while those for the Nasdaq 100 up 0.3%, with the S&P 500 marginally above flat.

title: Alphabet Reports Strong Quarter, Boosts 2025 Capital Spending
text: Brent Thill, Jefferies senior technology research analyst, and Bloomberg's Mandeep Singh break down Alphabet's 2nd quarter earnings as the tech giant reported strong sales and boosted capex. However, some concerns persist as Google tries to stay in the AI race.

title: Alphabet's valuation remains highly attractive, says Evercore ISI's Mark Mahaney
text: Mark Mahaney, Evercore ISI head of internet research, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss Alphabet's quarterly earnings results, state of Google Gemini development, capex spending, and more.

title: 5 Things to Know Before the Stock Market Opens
text: Stock futures are mixed in premarket trading as investors digest big Tech earnings from last night and watch for more.

title: Google Just Silenced Its Haters With This 1 Eye-Popping Number
text: Of the "Magnificent Seven" stocks, Alphabet (GOOGL -0.59%) (GOOG -0.31%) trades at the cheapest valuation by a significant margin, and has been over the past few years.

title: Daily stock watch: How investors are reacting to Tesla, Alphabet, and IBM's Q2 earnings
text: Tesla shares fell 6% in pre-trading after reporting a 12% revenue drop in second-quarter results. The stock rose slightly before the closing bell, before retreating on Thursday.

title: Google, Tesla Earnings Show Big Tech Winners Evolve. Why Some Are Falling Short.
text: Musk's lofty vision for robo-taxis, Google's spending on AI increases, Krispy Kreme joins the meme-stock revival, and more news to start your day.

title: Nvidia Stock Rises. It Got Good News from Google and Trump.
text: Nvidia was gaining after Google raised its capital expenditure forecast and President Donald Trump signed executive orders to boost AI deployment.

title: Is AI Killing Google Search? It Might Be Doing the Opposite
text: The world's dominant search engine is so far adapting well to the AI age.

title: 4 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks That Could Soar in the Second Half of 2025
text: Artificial intelligence (AI) investing remains the prevailing market theme, and it doesn't appear to be slowing. Even though 2025 is halfway over, there are still plenty of AI stocks that are worth your investment dollars and could see impressive growth throughout the rest of the year.

title: Google-parent Alphabet earnings shine with help of AI
text: Google-parent Alphabet on Wednesday reported quarterly profits that topped expectations, saying artificial intelligence has boosted every part of its business.

title: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Top Estimates (Revised)
text: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG) came out with quarterly earnings of $2.31 per share, beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $2.15 per share. This compares to earnings of $1.89 per share a year ago.

title: Alphabet earnings: Five key takeaways for UK investors
text: Alphabet Inc's (NASDAQ:GOOG) second-quarter update delivered several important signals for those with exposure through UK tech funds, ETFs, or direct holdings. Here are the five main things to digest: 1.
